body_html:
@fmassa yes I ported this table exactly for the purpose of adding support for cross-type binary operations (this is needed for backward compatibility with scalars).

Hmm you're raising a very good point. We might want to clip the max floating point type to that of one of the operands to prevent slowdowns on CUDA at a cost of the possibility that the multiplication result will over/underflow.

@fmassa yes I ported this table exactly for the purpose of adding support for cross-type binary operations (this is needed for backward compatibility with scalars).

Hmm you're raising a very good point. We might want to clip the max floating point type to that of one of the operands to prevent slowdowns on CUDA at a cost of the possibility that the multiplication result will over/underflow.
